I see the same amount of surveys regardless of if I have blocks on my account, if they've expired or if there are ZERO blocks...Add to that more surveys appearing for a split second and then ALL disappearing upon attempting one is pathetic.

Review.Titre: Like most survey sites
Review.Contenu: Like most survey sites, at first the surveys are relatively easy to qualify for, have a reasonable payoff, and you can accumulate enough points for a reward in a short period of time, sometimes the first day or two.  But the longer you are a member, the number of surveys dwindle, they become more difficult to qualify for, and the amount of points per minute ratio decreases rapidly.  It becomes hard to reconcile taking a survey that requires 30 minutes of your time and only get 30 points...which is .01 per minute, or a "pay rate" of 60 cents per hour.  All too frequently the time required is greatly underestimated so a survey advertised at 10 minutes you are only halfway through 15 minutes later.  So my advice to those who rate these surveys, or who read them, make sure you read the ones from people who have been the service for a month or so, not just the ones who have had it for a week.

Review.Titre: Prime Opinion: From Promising to Problematic
Review.Contenu: Prime Opinion initially presented itself as a promising platform for earning rewards through online surveys. The platform boasted a diverse range of surveys, a straightforward payout system, and a user-friendly interface. However, recent experiences have revealed a decline in the quality and productivity of the surveys offered.Screening Out and DisqualificationsOne of the most frustrating aspects of Prime Opinion is the high frequency of screening out and disqualifications. Users often invest time in completing surveys, only to be disqualified at the end, receiving no compensation for their efforts. This occurs even after completing qualifying questions and providing accurate information.Painful and Time-Consuming SurveysThe quality of surveys has also deteriorated significantly. Many surveys are poorly designed, repetitive, and unnecessarily lengthy. They often ask redundant questions and provide confusing instructions, leading to frustration and wasted time. The excessive length of some surveys makes them feel like a chore rather than a rewarding experience.Declining RewardsThe rewards offered for completing surveys have also become measly. The compensation no longer reflects the time and effort invested in these surveys. The payout thresholds have increased, making it more difficult to redeem rewards.ConclusionPrime Opinion has unfortunately fallen short of its initial promise. The frequent screening out, poorly designed surveys, and meager rewards have turned a once-productive platform into a frustrating and disappointing experience. Users are advised to seek alternative survey platforms that offer better compensation and a more worthwhile experience.

Review.Titre: I never qualify for full surveys
Unethical researchers abound and Prime Opinion sets no limits to protect both researcher AND participant
Review.Contenu: This company does NOT hold their researchers to any standards.  Studies say they'll take 15-minutes, they take 30-minutes or longer and then the study can screen you out up until the last question.  This has happened to me multiple times, it is not a rarity like the company would have you believe and at least twice, I thought the screen was changing because the study was finished and I was getting paid, but instead, they screened me out after the study was finished and paid me 3-cents for 29-minutes of my time.  I'm all for companies setting a certain criteria to be met for their research, but it should be in a reasonable amount of time ie 5-minutes to find out if you're what they're looking for.  Not after you answer all their screening questions, complete their studies and then screen you out right at the end.  And EVERY study will take at least 2-3X what the study says.  And a lot of studies will screen you out, which is fair enough, but they take way too long for it and most pay nothing when they screen you out, not even 3 or 4 cents.  You never know until you're paid that you're actually going to get paid for the time you put in.  I've only been on Prime Opinion 9-days and this is my experience.  The rate per hour on Prime Opinion is dismal and you have to be desperate for every penny to make this worth your time.Until Prime Opinion sets some ethical standards for their researchers, this will be an exercise in frustration for all.  Other survey sites have standards for the researchers to follow, so they can't just set out to take advantage of you, it's clear Prime Opinion has not done that and does not seem to want to do that in the future.  It's just commonsense that they should try to protect both sides, but they don't seem to care about the participants getting screwed by unethical researchers and to my knowledge even when you're screened out the researcher can still use your data.If you're going to get paid, they pay promptly, but you never know until the end if that's the case.Update:  Response to Prime OpinionI have done a lot of surveys on Prime Opinion, screening you out is not unusual and I don't have a problem with that if I don't fit the demographic, HOWEVER, the researchers are asking you the demographic questions, then letting you start or complete a survey for anywhere up to in my case 29-minutes was the longest and then screen you out after the last question and Prime Opinion allows this, because I did complain and on this occasion was told that the researchers can screen you out at anytime.  They should not be allowed to just waste your time.  They should ask any questions that may eliminate you upfront and not have you complete most of a study before screening you out.  Just tonight I spent 20-minutes or more on a study that was only suppose to take 10-minutes (all studies are 2-3X the estimate) and in that 20-minutes I had completed 70% of a study and was screened out.The fact that Prime Opinion replied the way you did trying to give the impression that screening out is a reasonable part of the business and doesn't happen that often, shows you will never do anything or set standards to improve the situation of abuse by the researchers.  I have acknowledged multiple times that screening out is reasonable as long as it's ALSO done in a REASONABLE amount of time, allowing you to complete 70-100% of a study before screening you out is NOT reasonable.  Even screening you out 10% into a survey is not reasonable.  Screening questions should be asked prior to starting the study.  I even got screened out of a study yesterday that said I qualified after the so-called demographic questions etc and then it said that "there are no correct answers, we just want your opinion" and I was still screened out after completing a decent amount of the study, clearly there were correct answers.  Screening questions should not include the survey itself, screening questions should be asked prior to the survey.It is clear that Prime Opinion does not intend to set standards making researchers ask all "elimination questions" upfront and in a reasonable amount of time, taking 20-30 minutes to screen you out is NOT reasonable, it's abusive.

And I am granted 1-4 points to compensate for that wasted 20 minutes.That said, despite the constant late screen-outs, I've earned decent money. One or two hours a day has given me at least $35 a week.

Time is precious, please pay us fairly for our time and trouble.  Thank You.

Review.Contenu: They have some surveys with a fair amount of payout points, but I have never been eligible for any of them.  The rest of the surveys are small to extremely small payout points for the time spent.  I spend a lot of time answering a lot of questions to be disqualified.  I have done a few surveys and didn't get paid at all.  They don't seem to be able to help me with that issue.  Having said that, they are extremely quick to redeem points and I've cashed out 3 times already in about a month.  The cashout minimum seems to be $10.  They also have an immediate bonus amount of points when you spend 7 days total doing at least one survey a day.  They also have bonus points for different levels you reach.  All in all, I like this site and will continue to use it.

Review.Titre: Ok for now but can be improved
Review.Contenu: For now( a couple months since i registered) Prime opinion is a slightly above average survey aggregator. with good and quick payout thresholds.Like with other Open survey Sites getting through screenings is rather cumbersome. But you Always get 1 Point. It's better than nothing. The overall Dashboard is kept Clean, simple, mobile friendly and being able to sort surveys by time or Points is neat.But sorting it by relevance is barely reliable and the simplicity can be annoying sometimes.For example: I don't own a car but the most relevant surveys are, if i have a certain car brand without any option to state I don't own any of them.Meaning 4 or 5 of these surveys stay on top with no option to opt out.A function to enter common demographic question in my profile to instantly sort those out would be a right step.But for now it works for me even with those gripes i have.Depending on how it develops I'll change my rating.

Review.Contenu: While the surveys generally work quite well there have been a lot of times where I have almost completed a survey after 25 or 30 minutes and just at the end I get kicked out and only received 1-4 points even though the survey itself was worth up to 100 points. I can understand if are removed from the survey in the first couple of minutes but not after that length of time. It seems to happen during the clarification questions at the end where I am usually just confirming information that was entered previously to qualify for the surevy in the first place.

Review.Titre: A lot of time wasted with surveys that…
Review.Contenu: A lot of time wasted with surveys that ask a lot of questions and then disqualify you with no points given. Or they disqualify you before even asking any questions at all.I understand that I will be screened out of some surveys as they want certain demographics, but I should not be answering 10 or 15 minutes worth of survey questions on their subject before being told I have been screened out with no points given. Also, I do not see how I am screened out before I answer even one question on some other surveys, and there are a lot like that.

Review.Titre: What I Like and Dislike About Prime Opinion
Review.Contenu: I like that it is an easy to use site. I have difficulty finding surveys for which I qualify. It infuriates me when I spend 10-15 minutes or more answering questions and the all of a sudden the pop- up thanks me and says I don’t qualify OR the site freezes and I have to close it.

Review.Titre: Too often I spend at least 5 minutes…
Review.Contenu: Too often I spend at least 5 minutes filling out a survey only to have it screen me out. I have also completed one or two that then say they have gathered enough surveys so you get no points.

Review.Titre: Customer Review
Review.Contenu: I disliked the fact that at times whilst doing surveys I was screened out for no particular reason. Also some of the questionnaires display false information as it relates to the amount of time they will take to complete.

Review.Titre: Quick payouts
Review.Contenu: Reasonably quick to build points and fast payment. Failed to manage to keep one 'streak' going because no surveys available at the time (could almost do with one held in reserve for this).

Review.Titre: I am disqualified from too many of the…
Review.Contenu: I am disqualified from too many of the surveys listed when I logon. Every time I log on, I click on a dozen, or more, surveys and get "you do not qualify". I realize my demographic profile disqualifies me from many surveys; it would be nice if they did not appear on my account page.

Review.Titre: Most surveys screen me out so they are…
Review.Contenu: Most surveys screen me out so they are a waste of my time. But I do appreciate that I and get $1 out at a time.

Review.Titre: decent
Review.Contenu: before it was good however it had started to remove me from so many surveys and overall had so many errors with their surveys

Review.Titre: Inconsistency with points available
Review.Contenu: I like that there are many, surveys, and a wide variety of lengths of surveys. Not qualifying regularly is frustrating, but you take the good with the bad. There is an inconsistency with the points available and time taken to do surveys. Also the times displayed can be a bit inaccurate

Review.Titre: They take too long to give their…
Review.Contenu: They take too long to give their rewards. I made a second request on September 21sr for 2000 points that they deducted from my account and I have not received any code yet to request my Amazon gift card.

Review.Titre: OK-ish
Review.Contenu: They seem reasonable but you really have to work hard to get points. Interestingly unlike Swagbucks  they do not match 100 points to £1.00.  Also  you can only withdraw Paypal cash  in chunks of £5.00 ( 633 points)

Review.Titre: It's ok for doing a few surveys while…

Review.Titre: More surveys, less time to load them
Review.Contenu: The survey questions ought to load faster. It takes a lot of useless time to do these. And then I get screened out more often than not. Why? My age? I buy just like anyone else. Just more particular and I know quality.

Review.Titre: I like taking Prime Surveys
Review.Contenu: I like taking Prime Surveys. I don't like when I am disqualified or blocked and I do not know why? It does not tell me the reason?

Review.Titre: Plenty surveys but a large number turn…
Review.Contenu: Plenty surveys but a large number turn me down. Some turn down immediately others after completion. However the points can add up fairly quickly.

Review.Titre: The survey choice & variety is good
Review.Contenu: The survey choice & variety is good. However the points have gone right down to below 100 in all categories now that I have a higher level. That's disappointing considering how much time I have out in over the past week

Review.Titre: The surveys seemed great for the first…
Review.Contenu: The surveys seemed great for the first week, when I was successfully completing them, but the second week, it seems harder to be successful. surveys are generally high values and are not too long either. I will continue to see if my completion rate improves.

Review.Titre: I find I qualify for more survey on…
Review.Contenu: I find I qualify for more survey on Prime Opinion than other survey sites.  Sometimes the surveys are a bit long and I wish I qualified for even more.  I'll keep trying.  thanks.

Review.Titre: Surveys
Review.Contenu: Most of the surveys are easy to answer & usually take about 1/2 hr from start to finish.  I do run into some surveys that for whatever reason won't let me select the order of priority by dragging them in the order of my priority.

Review.Titre: Survey Qualification
Review.Contenu: I qualified for several surveys tonight.  This is better than me spending over an hour trying to qualify to no avail.

Review.Titre: I love the idea on making a little…
Review.Contenu: I love the idea on making a little pocket money, however, there are many surveys that seem to gather substantial information and throw you out with no points. it is very frustrating when you get 90% through with no reward

Review.Titre: Very easy way to earn gift cards for my household
Review.Contenu: Jesus always provides for his people, so never doubt him. Very easy way to earn gift cards for what myself and my daughter want or need. This is one of the best sites I have visited so far that you can earn quickly. The best part I think is how fast (within minutes) you can choose your rewards and have them in your email to spend. That’s amazing especially when you may be in need of something for your household, no waiting, so that’s a plus. Only thing I don’t like is being denied so many surveys or all the ones about alcohol because I don’t drink.

Review.Titre: Easy To Do Surveys
Review.Contenu: The surveys are easy to understand and the points are applied right away.I would like more surveys that take a little longer and provide more points upon their completion.

Review.Titre: Recently joined
Review.Contenu: For the past three years I have taken part in other online survey sites and by far Prime Opinion is the best overall experience I have had. I no longer waste my time with other platforms.

Review.Titre: Easy money
Review.Contenu: Offers plenty of surveys daily. Cashing out is easy. Some surveys are redundant. But I find the site easy to use. Satisfied with payouts.

Review.Titre: Good Experience Overall
Review.Contenu: My experience has been positive for the most part. The points given for the surveys seems to be better than other survey sites I've used. The point bonus structure is also better. My only complaint would be that some surveys allow you to do a large portion of the survey then kicks me out saying "I'm not a good fit for this survey". This is after I've spent more than 10 minutes filling out questions. Waste of my time. This does not happen often, but when it does it's very frustrating.

Review.Titre: I enjoy doing Prime Opinion
Review.Contenu: I enjoy doing Prime Opinion, but get frustrated when start a survey and do it for a few minutes and then all of a sudden kicked out and only get 1 to 3 points with no reason

Review.Titre: helpful customer service
Review.Contenu: even though the customer service person could not help the situation i was reporting with some surveys, she did give me 100 points to my account. I appreciate the help.

Review.Titre: A bit of free money!
Review.Contenu: Well I did manage to earn £25.00 in the first 2 days after joining, but since then its more like £5.00 in 2 or 3 days. Still worth a punt if you have plenty of time on your hands though.

Review.Titre: I like Prime Opinion because you can…take a survey in five minutes or fifteen minutes and you get to choose the amount of time you want to spend here.
Review.Contenu: I like Prime Opinion because you can choose the type of survey you want to take. You can take a short survey, a best match survey or a more point survey. The surveys are fair and easy to take. It helps me earn my points to get a few small items for myself at home. Thank you and Merry Christmas!

Review.Titre: It's not easy to find the right surveys…
Review.Contenu: It's not easy to find the right surveys but overall great service, fast payout. I like it!

Review.Titre: I have used a few other survey sites.
Review.Contenu: I have used a few other survey sites in the past couple years and they all have the same issues of either not paying when you finish a survey or kick you off half way through.I have only used this site for a week now but have not had those problems yet on this site and have made the same amount of money in a week as I would in a month on another survey site.

Review.Titre: I enjoy the surveys

So often with competitors ones humour is blighted by the sheer length of the survey and worst still, that other survey no-no , Repetition.   There is a noticable lack of this in Prime Opinion Surveys and they are top of my list in their field.

I recommend if you want to make money online and if you just don't know what to do in the bus, well do a survey.

Other than that you will receive pay if you get enough points which is why i gave 4 stars.   It loses a star for the hit or miss of the companies that take advantage of people by having take an entire survey and not give credit.

I also wish the screen-out process was a bit more thorough, and the compensation reward cap higher than 4 points. I've been screened out of surveys after answering for 15 minutes sometimes. On the whole, though, Prime Opinion does have good surveys and pays well.

Review.Contenu: It seems like you can chat with staff at any given time and they try to help you as much as possible. $$$ amount for the surveys is good and you can get paid a thousand different ways and the payments are immediate except for the direct deposit, which took about 6-8 hours. Review.Titre: It's One of the Few Good Survey Sites
Review.Contenu: It's one of the better survey sites. Prime has the options for short surveys, high paying surveys (which will take longer). You can cash out with only 200 points with an $2.00 Amazon e-card. The threshold for paypal is 500 points. I also like the fact I can rate each individual survey once I'm done.

Review.Titre: Good site, underhand survey providers.
Review.Contenu: I've literally only been doing these surveys for about two weeks and Prime is the second site I've joined. Both sites in themselves are fine with Prime being slightly better. The big issue anyone will have if deciding to go down this route for a bit of extra money is not the standard/reliability of the surveys site themselves but the honesty of the survey providers.After only a short time, I've quickly realised that a lot of these survey providers are dishonest and underhand in a lot of their practices. The amount of times you'll enter a survey, give them valuable information for sometimes up to 6 or 7 mins only for them to get to the part where they actually decide if you're a match and kick you out.The criteria to decide whether you're a match should be given in the first minute or two or it's grossly unfair and frustrating.All in all it's a good way of making a few extra pounds if you can deal with a lot of frustration.

Review.Titre: Excellent!
Review.Contenu: I highly recommend Prime Opinion for anyone interested in paid surveys. Having subscribed to various survey platforms over the past five years, Prime Opinion stands out as one of the most satisfying experiences. What sets it apart is the almost instantaneous money transfers to PayPal, providing a quick and convenient way to access your earnings. Additionally, the platform offers the option to donate if you're feeling generous, adding a charitable dimension to your participation.One notable feature is the daily availability of a diverse selection of surveys that you can qualify for, enhancing your earning potential. While it's true that the pay may be slightly lower compared to some claims, in my opinion, Prime Opinion remains one of the best-paid survey platforms. It's important to note that, like any survey platform, some surveys may take longer than estimated, which is a common aspect of this type of opportunity.
